originContent: A collection of Azure Automation runbooks for Microsoft 365 and Intune management.
translatedContent: A collection of Azure Automation runbooks for Microsoft 365 and Intune management.

originContent: ## Overview
translatedContent: ## Overview

originContent: This repository contains PowerShell scripts designed to be used as Azure Automation runbooks for automating various Microsoft 365 and Intune management tasks. These scripts help streamline administrative processes, maintain consistency across your environment, and reduce manual overhead.
translatedContent: This repository contains PowerShell scripts designed to be used as Azure Automation runbooks for automating various Microsoft 365 and Intune management tasks. These scripts help streamline administrative processes, maintain consistency across your environment, and reduce manual overhead.

originContent: ## Repository Structure
translatedContent: ## Repository Structure

originContent: The repository is organized into folders, with each folder containing a specific runbook solution:
translatedContent: The repository is organized into folders, with each folder containing a specific runbook solution:

originContent: Azure-Runbooks/
translatedContent: Azure-Runbooks/

originContent: ├── DeviceCategorySync/             # Sync device categories with user departments
translatedContent: ├── DeviceCategorySync/             # Sync device categories with user departments

originContent: ├── Report-DiscoveredApps/          # Generate reports of discovered applications
translatedContent: ├── Report-DiscoveredApps/          # Generate reports of discovered applications

originContent: ├── Report-IntuneDeviceCompliance/  # Generate device compliance reports
translatedContent: ├── Report-IntuneDeviceCompliance/  # Generate device compliance reports

originContent: ├── Report-DevicesWithApp/          # Find devices with specific applications
translatedContent: ├── Report-DevicesWithApp/          # Find devices with specific applications

originContent: ├── Alert-DeviceSyncReminder/       # Send reminders for devices needing sync
translatedContent: ├── Alert-DeviceSyncReminder/       # Send reminders for devices needing sync

originContent: ├── Update-AutopilotDeviceGroupTags/ # Sync Autopilot group tags with Intune categories
translatedContent: ├── Update-AutopilotDeviceGroupTags/ # Sync Autopilot group tags with Intune categories

originContent: ├── Alert-IntuneAppleTokenMonitor/  # Monitor Apple token expirations
translatedContent: ├── Alert-IntuneAppleTokenMonitor/  # Monitor Apple token expirations

originContent: ├── Report-UserManagers/            # Generate reports of users and their managers
translatedContent: ├── Report-UserManagers/            # Generate reports of users and their managers

originContent: ├── Report-MissingSecurityUpdates/  # Report on devices missing security updates
translatedContent: ├── Report-MissingSecurityUpdates/  # Report on devices missing security updates

originContent: ├── Sync-IntuneDevices/             # Force sync all managed Intune devices
translatedContent: ├── Sync-IntuneDevices/             # Force sync all managed Intune devices

originContent: ├── Report-DeviceSyncOverdue/       # Report on devices overdue for sync
translatedContent: ├── Report-DeviceSyncOverdue/       # Report on devices overdue for sync

originContent: ├── Report-OneDriveSharedItems/     # Generate reports of shared items in OneDrive
translatedContent: ├── Report-OneDriveSharedItems/     # Generate reports of shared items in OneDrive

originContent: ├── Task-SetCompanyAttribute/       # Set company attribute for all users
translatedContent: ├── Task-SetCompanyAttribute/       # Set company attribute for all users

originContent: ├── Snipe-IT-UserSync/              # Sync Microsoft 365 users to Snipe-IT users
translatedContent: ├── Snipe-IT-UserSync/              # Sync Microsoft 365 users to Snipe-IT users

originContent: ├── Sync-IntuneToAction1Categories/ # Sync Intune device categories to Action1 custom attributes
translatedContent: ├── Sync-IntuneToAction1Categories/ # Sync Intune device categories to Action1 custom attributes
Each runbook folder contains:

originContent: Each runbook folder contains:
translatedContent: - The main PowerShell script (`.ps1`)

originContent: - The main PowerShell script (`.ps1`)
translatedContent: - A helper script for setting up permissions (`Add-GraphPermissions.ps1`)

originContent: - A helper script for setting up permissions (`Add-GraphPermissions.ps1`)
translatedContent: - Detailed documentation (`README.md`)

originContent: - Detailed documentation (`README.md`)

translatedContent: ## Authentication

originContent: ## Authentication

translatedContent: All runbooks in this repository are designed to use Azure Automation's System-Assigned Managed Identity for authentication, which is the recommended approach for Azure Automation. Each folder includes an `Add-GraphPermissions.ps1` script that helps assign the necessary Microsoft Graph API permissions to your Automation Account's Managed Identity.

originContent: All runbooks in this repository are designed to use Azure Automation's System-Assigned Managed Identity for authentication, which is the recommended approach for Azure Automation. Each folder includes an `Add-GraphPermissions.ps1` script that helps assign the necessary Microsoft Graph API permissions to your Automation Account's Managed Identity.

translatedContent: ## Getting Started

originContent: ## Getting Started

translatedContent: Each runbook includes detailed documentation for implementation and usage. In general, to use these runbooks:

originContent: Each runbook includes detailed documentation for implementation and usage. In general, to use these runbooks:

translatedContent: 1. Import the script into your Azure Automation account

originContent: 1. Import the script into your Azure Automation account
translatedContent: 2. Enable System-Assigned Managed Identity on your Automation account

originContent: 2. Enable System-Assigned Managed Identity on your Automation account
translatedContent: 3. Use the included `Add-GraphPermissions.ps1` script to assign necessary Graph API permissions

originContent: 3. Use the included `Add-GraphPermissions.ps1` script to assign necessary Graph API permissions
translatedContent: 4. Configure any required parameters specific to your environment

originContent: 4. Configure any required parameters specific to your environment
translatedContent: 5. Schedule the runbook or run it on-demand as needed

originContent: 5. Schedule the runbook or run it on-demand as needed

translatedContent: ## Available Runbooks

originContent: ## Available Runbooks

translatedContent: ### Reporting

originContent: ### Reporting
translatedContent: - **Device Compliance Report**: Generate comprehensive compliance reports for Intune-managed devices.

originContent: - **Device Compliance Report**: Generate comprehensive compliance reports for Intune-managed devices.
translatedContent: - **Discovered Apps Report**: Create detailed reports of applications discovered on managed devices.

originContent: - **Discovered Apps Report**: Create detailed reports of applications discovered on managed devices.
translatedContent: - **Devices with Specific App Report**: Identify all devices with a specific application installed.

originContent: - **Devices with Specific App Report**: Identify all devices with a specific application installed.
translatedContent: - **User Managers Report**: Generate a report of all licensed internal users along with their manager information.

originContent: - **User Managers Report**: Generate a report of all licensed internal users along with their manager information.
translatedContent: - **Missing Security Updates Report**: Identify Windows devices missing multiple security updates with automated reporting.

originContent: - **Missing Security Updates Report**: Identify Windows devices missing multiple security updates with automated reporting.
translatedContent: - **Device Sync Overdue Report**: Generate reports of devices that haven't synced within a specified threshold.

originContent: - **Device Sync Overdue Report**: Generate reports of devices that haven't synced within a specified threshold.
translatedContent: - **OneDrive Shared Items Report**: Create reports of items shared externally in OneDrive for Business.

originContent: - **OneDrive Shared Items Report**: Create reports of items shared externally in OneDrive for Business.

translatedContent: ### Device Management

originContent: ### Device Management
translatedContent: - **Device Category Sync**: Automatically synchronize Intune device categories based on user department information.

originContent: - **Device Category Sync**: Automatically synchronize Intune device categories based on user department information.
translatedContent: - **Autopilot Group Tag Sync**: Keep Autopilot device group tags in sync with Intune device categories.

originContent: - **Autopilot Group Tag Sync**: Keep Autopilot device group tags in sync with Intune device categories.
translatedContent: - **Force Device Sync**: Initiate sync commands for all managed Intune devices with batching and throttling protection.

originContent: - **Force Device Sync**: Initiate sync commands for all managed Intune devices with batching and throttling protection.
translatedContent: - **Intune to Action1 Category Sync**: Sync Intune device categories to Action1 custom attributes by matching serial numbers.

originContent: - **Intune to Action1 Category Sync**: Sync Intune device categories to Action1 custom attributes by matching serial numbers.

translatedContent: ### Alerts and Notifications

originContent: ### Alerts and Notifications
translatedContent: - **Device Sync Reminder**: Send automated email reminders to users whose devices haven't synced recently.

originContent: - **Device Sync Reminder**: Send automated email reminders to users whose devices haven't synced recently.
translatedContent: - **Apple Token Monitor**: Monitor and alert on Apple Push Notification certificate and token expirations.

originContent: - **Apple Token Monitor**: Monitor and alert on Apple Push Notification certificate and token expirations.
### User Management
translatedContent: ### User Management

originContent: - **Company Attribute Setting**: Set a consistent company attribute across all user accounts in your Microsoft 365 tenant.
translatedContent: - **Company Attribute Setting**: Set a consistent company attribute across all user accounts in your Microsoft 365 tenant.

originContent: - **Snipe-IT User Sync**: Create or update Snipe-IT users from your Microsoft 365 tenant, using email as the anchor, with secure passwords for new users and optional login/invite toggles.
translatedContent: - **Snipe-IT User Sync**: Create or update Snipe-IT users from your Microsoft 365 tenant, using email as the anchor, with secure passwords for new users and optional login/invite toggles.

originContent: ### Third-Party Integration
translatedContent: ### Third-Party Integration

originContent: - **Action1 Integration**: Sync Intune device categories to Action1 RMM custom attributes for unified device management across platforms.
translatedContent: - **Action1 Integration**: Sync Intune device categories to Action1 RMM custom attributes for unified device management across platforms.

originContent: ## Branch Management
translatedContent: ## Branch Management

originContent: This repository follows a simplified Git workflow:
translatedContent: This repository follows a simplified Git workflow:

originContent: - The `main` branch contains stable, production-ready scripts
translatedContent: - The `main` branch contains stable, production-ready scripts

originContent: - Development branches are created for new features or significant modifications
translatedContent: - Development branches are created for new features or significant modifications

originContent: - Once development work is merged into `main`, the development branches are typically deleted
translatedContent: - Once development work is merged into `main`, the development branches are typically deleted

originContent: - For users who have cloned this repository, note that development branches may disappear after their work is completed
translatedContent: - For users who have cloned this repository, note that development branches may disappear after their work is completed

originContent: If you're working with a specific development branch, consider creating your own fork to ensure your work isn't affected when branches are deleted.
translatedContent: If you're working with a specific development branch, consider creating your own fork to ensure your work isn't affected when branches are deleted.

originContent: ## What's New in v1.4.0
translatedContent: ## What's New in v1.4.0

originContent: ### New Runbook: Sync-IntuneToAction1Categories
translatedContent: ### New Runbook: Sync-IntuneToAction1Categories

originContent: This release introduces a new integration with Action1 RMM, enabling automated synchronization of Intune device categories to Action1 custom attributes. Key features include:
translatedContent: This release introduces a new integration with Action1 RMM, enabling automated synchronization of Intune device categories to Action1 custom attributes. Key features include:

originContent: - Automatic matching of devices between Intune and Action1 using serial numbers
translatedContent: - Automatic matching of devices between Intune and Action1 using serial numbers

originContent: - Syncs Intune device categories to configurable Action1 custom attributes
translatedContent: - Syncs Intune device categories to configurable Action1 custom attributes

originContent: - Supports multiple Action1 regions (North America, Europe, Australia)
translatedContent: - Supports multiple Action1 regions (North America, Europe, Australia)

originContent: - Secure credential management through Azure Automation encrypted variables
translatedContent: - Secure credential management through Azure Automation encrypted variables

originContent: - WhatIf mode for testing without making changes
translatedContent: - WhatIf mode for testing without making changes

originContent: - Comprehensive logging and statistics
translatedContent: - Comprehensive logging and statistics

originContent: - Built on the PSAction1 PowerShell module
translatedContent: - Built on the PSAction1 PowerShell module

originContent: This integration helps organizations maintain consistent device categorization across both Microsoft Intune and Action1 RMM platforms, enabling better reporting, policy application, and device management workflows.
translatedContent: This integration helps organizations maintain consistent device categorization across both Microsoft Intune and Action1 RMM platforms, enabling better reporting, policy application, and device management workflows.

originContent: ## Discussions
translatedContent: ## Discussions

originContent: I've enabled GitHub Discussions for this repository to foster collaboration and support among users. This is the best place to:
translatedContent: I've enabled GitHub Discussions for this repository to foster collaboration and support among users. This is the best place to:

originContent: * Ask questions about implementing specific runbooks
translatedContent: * Ask questions about implementing specific runbooks

originContent: * Share your success stories and implementations
translatedContent: * Share your success stories and implementations

originContent: * Suggest new runbook ideas or improvements
translatedContent: * Suggest new runbook ideas or improvements

translatedContent: * Discuss best practices for Azure Automation

originContent: * Get help with troubleshooting
translatedContent: * Get help with troubleshooting

originContent: Check out the [Discussions](https://github.com/sargeschultz11/Azure-Runbooks/discussions) tab to join the conversation. We encourage you to use Discussions for general questions and community interaction, while Issues should be used for reporting bugs or specific problems with the scripts.

We encourage you to use Discussions for general questions and community interaction, while Issues should be used for reporting bugs or specific problems with the scripts.
